item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Drew Barrymore
item.description: "You know you're putting a good thing out into the universe when you put on glitter." -- Drew Barrymore

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Denise Hunter
item.description: "Mercy, but he smelled good. All piney and musky and manly. There should be a law." -- Denise Hunter

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Jennifer add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?" -- George Eliot

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "A life not lived for others is not a life." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description: "The good you do today may be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Hard Rock Cafe
item.description: "Love all, serve all." -- Hard Rock Cafe

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I am a great and sublime fool. But then I am God's fool, and all His works must be contemplated with respect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "There's always going to be bad stuff out there. But here's the amazing thing -- light trumps darkness, every time. You stick a candle into the dark, but you can't stick the dark into the light." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "A photo says, you were happy, and I wanted to catch that. A photo says, you were so important to me that I put down everything else to come watch." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Barry Lopez
item.description: "Sometimes a person needs a story more than food to stay alive." -- Barry Lopez

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Annie Barrows
item.description: "Reading good books spoils you for enjoying bad books." -- Annie Barrows

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Minor Myers
item.description: "Go into the world and do well. But more importantly, go into the world and do good." -- Minor Myers

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Beth Hoffman
item.description: "Everyone needs to find the one thing that brings out her passion. It's what we do and share with the world that matters. I believe it's important that we leave our communities in better shape than we found them." -- Beth Hoffman

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Remember!--It is Christianity to do good always--even to those who do evil to us. It is Christianity to love our neighbours as ourself, and to do to all men as we would have them do to us. It is Christianity to be gentle, merciful and forgiving, and to keep those qualities quiet in our own hearts, and never make a boast of them or of our prayers or of our love of God, but always to show that we love Him by humbly trying to do right in everything. If we do this, and remember the life and lessons of Our Lord Jesus Christ, and try to act up to them, we may confidently hope that God will forgive us our sins and mistakes, and enable us to live and die in peace." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by C.A. Belmond
item.description: "You must live every day as if it counts, which means to love all of it. Never let a single one go by without noting the color of the sky, the song of the bird, the face of the one you love best. And don't let yourself get talked out of the things you really care about, don't put off what you want to be." -- C.A. Belmond

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Edward Everett Hale
item.description: "I am only one, but I am one. I cannot do everything, but I can do something. And because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do the something that I can do." -- Edward Everett Hale
